intro: Calyptracordia, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, often spiny leaves and showy, umbellate inflorescences. They are native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. Calyptracordia species typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. The plants are known for their ornamental value and, in some cases, for their toxic properties.
